quotes.t: Hollywood, Madison Avenue, the FCC, and a growing {qword}contingent{/qword} in corporate America: It's hard to imagine a more formidable alliance pushing segregated television.

But just because we banned it [DDT] domestically, under pressure from the bird-watching {qword}contingent{/qword} … it doesn't necessarily follow that the rest of the world was about to jump on the bandwagon.
A Maori {qword}contingent{/qword}, unable to face the intensity of the Turkish fire, sought shelter in a nearby gully.

et: (sense 1) borrowed from French, "portion that falls to one as a return, part given or received in a common effort, body of troops contributed by an ally," noun derivative of {it}contingent,{/it} adjective, "falling to someone as a share, dependent, {et_link|contingent:1|contingent:1}"; (sense 2) noun derivative of {et_link|contingent:1|contingent:1}
